Class SocketClient

java.lang.Object
java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
it.polimi.it.galaxytrucker.networking.client.Client
it.polimi.it.galaxytrucker.networking.client.socket.SocketClient
All Implemented Interfaces:
ClientInterface, Serializable, Runnable, Remote
public class SocketClient extends Client
This class represents the client logic implemented using Socket technology. It handles communication with a server over a pre-established socket connection, sending user inputs and receiving game updates.

This client implements SocketVirtualClient (representing the client-side of a server's logical connection), Runnable to manage its listening thread, and ClientInterface to provide a standardized client interface.

Version:
1.2
Author:
giacomoamaducci

    • receiveUserInput

      public void receiveUserInput(UserInput input)
      Passes a UserInput object to the client to be interpreted and converted into relevant game actions.

      This implementation serializes the provided UserInput object into a JSON string. The JSON string is then sent to the server asynchronously via the socket's output stream using an ExecutorService.

      If an IOException occurs during serialization or network transmission, it is caught and re-thrown as a RuntimeException.

      Specified by:
      receiveUserInput in interface ClientInterface
      Specified by:
      receiveUserInput in class Client
      Parameters:
      input - The UserInput object to be serialized and sent to the server. This parameter corresponds to the input parameter in the inherited documentation from the ClientInterface interface.
